This game is the best asymmetric game I have played; It is easy to grasp but has a lot of depth. I started playing because I love the horror genre and although its not as scary as when I first started playing, it still has scary moments every once in awhile. Finally, there is a lot of developer support and years after release, we are getting great new characters and updates! Both sides are very fun to play but each has there own nuances to learn. I hope to see you in the next trial(:

People complain about how greedy and toxic the devs are, and that's true, but honestly the community and devs deserve each other. This game has one of the most toxic and unwelcoming communities in the entire industry. Receiving death threats and wishes of cancer upon your entire family because you made some minor error just means that it's a day that ends in y.

Even without those issues, this game is very simplistic and not worth the investment, especially considering how much money you'd have to dish out to buy many of the DLCs that you'll need to be competitive. It's hardly a horror game considering it loses its horror value very quickly.

ゲームバランスが悪く、サバイバー優遇キラー不遇が顕著なので根本的に運営が考えを改めないかぎりおすすめできる要素はありません
しかし、ゲーム自体は非常に面白いので今後のアップデート次第で評価は変わると思います。

É muito bom, uma sensação indescritível receber pallet na cabeça em mapa com 55 pallets por metro quadrado, sobrevivente sumindo, teleportando, se curando instantaneamente, três geradores ficando prontos ao mesmo tempo com 2 minutos de jogo, uma delicia jogar Dead by Daylight, melhor que isso só comer pedra, beber vidro, bater de carro, dar murro em ponta de faca, chorar no banheiro, lembrar Dela, ouvir sertanejo, beber produto de limpeza, tirando isso tudo dbd é uma das minhas coisas preferidas de fazer pra passar o tempo

Besides the overwhelming bugs, the irritating hitboxes, DBD is a great game without a doubt. Its so fascinating to learn new techs, pulling of some insane plays by using a flashlight and other resources you have been given. Messing around with friends in this game really feels different. I had a go on this game after two years and it probably was one of the best decisions  I have ever made (when it comes to gaming ofc)

DBD has addressed the allegations of NFTs publicly.  They do not use them, and people using the review system to spread rumors should do research beyond what they see on social media.  The Devs for DBD work to make sure the game has regular updates and new contents, and this is how they are repaid by their community?  Sad really.

The game is fun, and ever changing.  You can play solo or with friends.  You can be the killer or the survivor.  DBD has the popularity it doesnbecause the DEVs continue to work on the game, and they are quick to address issues the best they can.  More complex issues take longer, and because they are so fast with small issues many players get frustrated when it takes longer.  That the issues are eventually fixed is evidence they are working on it consistently and thoroughly.

Well, I love this game. I wish people were cool, but sadly, the community consist of a bunch of bitches, people I probably picked on in middle school and high school, only saying "gg" when they win, and if they lose, a bunch of insults. This game is a huge relief, it makes me not feel bad when i kicked those kids asses after school. You know who you are. The game sometimes makes me want to tunnel the shit out of someone just cause they start to crouch up and down as if they're bouncing on some invisible dick, this isn't Halo. People are so toxic on here. Anyways. This game kicks ass and i love being a bully on here, and even when I lose, i still had a great time. Highly recommend.

I used to love DBD.

But this past year has been abysmal for the game. It's become increasingly clear that the game is built upon the messiest spaghetti code around. Every single update they do now adds some kind of huge issue that messes everything up. Blight? Had barely any hitboxes on terrain, so he was basically useless at launch. The Resident Evil DLC? The map broke instantly and took itself out of commission for MONTHS. It broke itself so bad it started to break other maps somehow. Nemesis? Bricked lower end PCs if people played against him. Pinhead? Voice lines immediately broke on release (despite them working just fine in the PTU). The new matchmaking system is a complete joke. Play a Killer you JUST bought and have zero perks on? Have an Iridescent SWF party. It's been YEARS and they only just trotted out a couple accessibility features because the community was crying out for it and they caused a stir by dunking on accessibility. 

That's all without even considering the recent scandal. The game is just broken and breaking further and further with every update. 

I'm done with it. I can't be bothered to deal with it any longer. Especially given who they're aligning with now... Yeah... Nah. Bye, BHVR.
